name: Group_&_Events_Travel.xlsx
data: Due to insurance and risk considerations, associates flying together on one plane must be fewer than forty (for Winner's Circle the limit is fewer) unless approved by the Company's Risk Manager via Travel Feedback email box in Outlook. It is NOT advisable for large teams to travel on the same flight.

It is important that policies and guidelines be established for groups as there is a great opportunity to negotiate reduced rates for air travel, lodging, meals and other required services. (i) The travel policy shall include a definition of a group, i.e.., minimum number of employees to which group meeting policy applies.The definition should provide detail as to why the policy exists, who it is targetted towards and what is required of all individuals who need to follow it.Consider also adding the requirements of an attendee (From the organisation) upon attending a meeting or event

Rating is Partial Because: The policy only mentions group size limit for air travel but does not provide a complete definition of what constitutes a group or meeting.Content: Need to add comprehensive definition of what qualifies as a group event, minimum number of attendees, and attendee requirements.

Certain company events (such as offsite meetings or Symposium) may disallow business class travel and the go coach for cash program in order to meet budget constraints. Event specific travel policies supersede the Global Travel and Entertainment Policy.

The policy states (i) booking instructions including requiring that arrangements be made through a designated meetings management group/designated travel agency.  If such a resource exists, (ii) its use must be mandated and contact details for the individual or department responsible for Group & Meeting travel are provided.

Rating is Partial Because: While booking instructions are provided, it does not mandate use of designated meetings management group/travel agency.Content: Need to specify designated meetings management group and mandate their use for group bookings.
The policy states (i) a list of preferred venues MGE suppliers such as production, creative and technical providers (ii) should mandate the use of preferred vendors for group events.

Rating is Null Because: No information about preferred venues or MGE suppliersContent: Need to add list of preferred venues and mandate use of preferred vendors for group events including production, creative and technical providers.

The policy states (i) Expense guidelines shall be included in the policy and (ii) the policy shall require budget pre-approval from the specified management level based on nature of the meeting and total budgeted expenditure.

Rating is Null Because: No expense guidelines or budget pre-approval requirements specifiedContent: Need to add expense guidelines and budget pre-approval requirements based on meeting type and total budget.
The policy states the required authorization procedures for (i) group-related expenses as well as (ii) individual participant's expense claims related to the group meetings.
Rating is Null Because: No authorization procedures defined for group expensesContent: Need to add authorization procedures for both group expenses and individual participant expense claims.

The policy indicates (i)  the preferred method of payment for group & meeting related expenses if it differs to the instruction in the general travel arrangements or expense management. Alternatively refers to that  (link/section/area).
Rating is Null Because: No payment methods specified for group/meeting expensesContent: Need to specify preferred payment methods for group & meeting related expenses.

The policy states: (i) Individual hotel charges not covered as part of the group & meeting event guidelines  must be billed to employees personal card unless otherwise specified (ii) refer back to lodging travel policy section
Rating is Null Because: No guidance on individual hotel charges for group eventsContent: Need to specify policy for individual hotel charges not covered under group event guidelines.

The policy states: (i) Individual meal charges not covered as part of the group & meeting event guidelines  must be billed to employees personal card unless otherwise specified  (ii) refer back to meals travel policy section
Rating is Null Because: No guidance on individual meal charges for group eventsContent: Need to specify policy for individual meal charges not covered under group event guidelines.

The policy states: (i) Meeting hosts and/or the designated meeting planners selecting off-site company locations such as meeting venues are accountable for ensuring adequate security measures are taken for the safety of meeting attendees in alignment with the corporate risk management department (If applicable)
Rating is Null Because: No meeting security/risk management requirements specifiedContent: Need to add security requirements for off-site meeting venues and safety measures for attendees.
Questions should be directed to: Travel Feedback in Outlook.
The policy states: (i) The contact details for individual/department responsible for  Group & Meeting travel are provided.

Rating is Partial Because: Only general travel feedback contact provided, not specific group/meeting contactContent: Need to add specific contact details for group & meeting travel department/personnel.
Companion Accompaniment at the Request of the Company

The policy states (i) If a companion is invited to travel with a senior executive employee at the request of the Company, expenses will be reimbursed and the travel expenditures subject to the same policy requirements as those of an employee.  (ii) The policy will indicate if company insurance coverage extends to the companion.
Rating is Null Because: No policy on company-requested companion travelContent: Need to specify policy for companion travel at company request including reimbursement and insurance coverage.
The policy states  (i) If the policy permits a companion to travel with a senior executive employee, the policy will state whether any additional costs are reimbursable by the Company (ii) or not.
Rating is Null Because: No policy on personal companion travelContent: Need to specify whether personal companion travel is permitted and any reimbursable costs.

If you are traveling on business and you would like to add on a personal trip, if it is possible you should book that personal portion outside of the TMC. If the business trip (alone w/o a personal extension) is higher than the cost of business and personal together (i.e. the personal portion adds zero additional expense), the TMC will be able to ticket this as it is within the cost of the business portion. However, the two different scenarios/fares must be attached as support to your expense report.

The policy states (i) whether personal travel can be combined with business; usually it is permitted if there is no additional cost to the organization and supervisor approval is obtained. (ii) The policy will outline if corporate-negotiated rates and insurances are applicable to the personal/leisure portion of the trip.  (iii)  The policy will require the employee to clearly indicate, in writing, the portion of the trip deemed personal for purposes of Company liability, insurance coverage, etc. (including stop overs).

Rating is Partial Because: While personal travel combination is addressed, insurance coverage details missingContent: Need to add details about insurance coverage and liability for personal portion of trip.
Personal Use of Corporate Preferred Rates
The policy states: (i) whether company preferred vendors and/or negotiated rates can be used by employees for personal travel. Allowing use may impact tracking of corporate usage volumes.
Rating is Null Because: No policy on personal use of corporate preferred ratesContent: Need to specify whether employees can use company preferred vendors/rates for personal travel.
Personal Use of Corporate Online Reservation Tool

The policy states: (i) whether the company online reservation tool can be used by employees for personal travel.  (ii) The policy will indicate whether company preferred vendors and/or negotiated rates can be used by employees for personal travel; allowing use may impact tracking of usage volume.  (iii) The policy must indicate if the corporate card can be used.
Rating is Null Because: No policy on personal use of online reservation toolContent: Need to specify whether employees can use company online tool for personal travel and applicable vendor rates.

If you are traveling on business and you would like to bring a companion, the companion is only authorized to book travel via our Travel Management Company if an approved exception from Travel Feedback is obtained beforehand.

The policy states (i)  the preferred method of payment of companion-personal travel related expenses;  (ii) use of the company corporate card must be mandated only if the travel is at the request of the Company.
Rating is Partial Because: While companion booking process mentioned, payment methods not specifiedContent: Need to specify preferred payment methods for companion travel expenses.
